bioAsHtml: By day I am an enterprise programmer rescuing projects from wrong architectural choices, bad designs and legacy coding practices. By night I am moonlighting in functional programming and data analytics.

acceptedTalks.summaryAsHtml: Data visualization plays an important part when exploring a dataset and when presenting/publishing results. Traditionally this field has been dominated by R and Python. But the Scala community has made an effort to catch up. I'll present 3 tools that can be used for visualizations: Breeze, Scala Notebook and Sparkle. While these are far from being perfect, the case can be made to include Scala tools in a data analytics workflow.
acceptedTalks.title: Data Visualization with Scala tools

bio: By day I am an enterprise programmer rescuing projects from wrong architectural choices, bad designs and legacy coding practices. By night I am moonlighting in functional programming and data analytics.
